title.rendered: Nancy Colmenares, the first wife of Hugo Chávez, died

content.rendered:
• The information was confirmed by the first vice president of the PSUV, Diosdado Cabello. Colmenares worked as a primary school teacher in her native Barinas

This Saturday, April 23, Nancy Colmenares, the first wife of former President Hugo Rafael Chávez Frías, passed away.

The information was confirmed by the first vice president of the PSUV, Diosdado Cabello, during a party plenary.

We received the unfortunate news of the physical departure of comrade Nancy Colmenares, who was the first wife of our Comandante Chávez and who accompanied him in those first moments and always,” said Cabello.

Share on

Colmenares was born in Barinas and was married to Chávez from 1977 to 1995. With him she had three children: Rosa Virginia, María Gabriela and Hugo Rafael.

Nancy Colmenares

According to journalist Nelson Bocaranda, Chávez’s ex-wife had been hospitalized for several days in a clinic in Caracas and died in the company of her two daughters.

A low key life

Colmenares is a primary school teacher in the town of Sabaneta de Barinas, where former President Chávez’s family originated.

Her marriage to the former president was unstable and ended three years after the socialist leader led the 1992 coup attempt against then-president Carlos Andrés Pérez.

After his divorce from Colemenares, Chávez married television presenter and producer Marisabel Rodríguez in 1997 and they divorced in 2004. Rosa Inés Chávez, the youngest of the former president’s children, was born from that marriage.

During his statement on television this Saturday, Diosdado Cabello referred to how important Nancy Colmenares was for Chávez.

“Yesterday we were with fellow president Nicolás Maduro, until very late at night, we were at the meeting and we received news, of the news we don’t like; Mrs. Nancy Colmenares, first wife of our Commander Hugo Chávez, passed away yesterday. The ‘black Nancy’, as he called her, was an extraordinary woman who accompanied her in the first moments of the fight, and she not only accompanied her, she was always with him,” she said.

Nancy Colmenares kept a low profile after Hugo Chavez won the presidential elections in 1999. The president referred to her on several occasions, however, both had separate lives.

Of the children that Nancy Colmenares had with Hugo Chávez, María Gabriela is the one who has maintained a more public profile. She was a diplomat before the United Nations, but resigned from her post in 2019

Almost two months ago, it was nine years since the death of Hugo Chávez. The communist leader died on March 5, 2013 from cancer that he suffered from. The former president spent several months in a health center in Havana (Cuba) and was later transferred to the Dr. Carlos Arvelo Military Hospital where he died at the age of 58.
